content.description: Morphine for Breakfast climbs the clean and proud overhung face of the obvious jetting fin. Start in the out-cove below the left side of the fin. Climb through a series of easy moves before plunging into the no fall zone of the upper headwall. Commit to the finishing jug after a series of cool pockets and edges. Exciting.
content.protection: Many Pads and a calm spotter.
content.location: 40 feet to the South of the confluence of Kelly and Pumphouse. Obvious overhung orange face of jetting fin.

content.description: Jack and the Beanstock climbs the amazing Iron rib right of Human Wasteland. Start on small sloping ledges below the Iron Beanstock. Dynamically move or dyno to the first Iron jug. Climb the Iron Beanstock to the clouds. Sticking the Dyno is the crux. Favors the tall.
content.location: Directly to the right of Human Wasteland.

content.description: Human Wasteland is a must do area testpiece! Named after the obvious destruction of the area Human Wasteland was the first tried line at West Kelly. Human Wasteland climbs the tallest and proudest feature in the area. Start on sloping angled crimps climb through series of big moves on good holds. Rest before the upper overhung head wall and commit to big moves on worsening holds. Be prepared for the desperate and committing final crux move to the topout. Highball testpiece, no joke.
content.location: 15 feet to the South of Morphine for Breakfast. Obvious tall and proud feature. Water will encroach in the Spring.

content.description: Deep Creek climbs out the sloping and at times chossy roof 25 feet south of Human Wasteland. Start on holds and climb out left angling fin/ledge out roof. Exciting and sandy topout. Water covers landing in the Spring
The series of tall and clean lines on the East Wall of Pumphouse. Water will encroach during the Spring.
